Github

Bringing the Portland developer community together.

We're building a community focused on helping each other find jobs, solve problems, make friends, and so much more.

This group is still getting off the ground, so you can be a part from the very beginning. Add your email to get notified of what's going on, or drop us a note to say hi: info@pdxdevs.org

Hear when this thing starts

Who can join?

Anyone can join! We're open to folks of all experience levels, tech professions, age, gender - and even location if you're nice enough ;)

Slack, Discord, IRC? Where is this thing happening?

Help us decide! Right now, I'm leaning towards slack. Many people already have it open for work, so it has some network effects. Think Discord is better? Spectrum? RocketChat? Make a pitch for your favorite: info@pdxdevs.org. Our priorities are:

  • Free (or very cheap). We do not have a budget.
  • Accessible. Both in the "easy to learn to use" sense and also the screenreader sense.
  • Fun. Custom emojis are a plus. I like the slackbot auto-reply thing.

So, it doesn't exist yet? What's the plan?

No, it doesn't exist just yet. One danger of a group like this is that there's not enough going on initially and people stop showing up. I'm hoping we can generate some interest, then do a "launch" and turn the whole thing on. Ride that momentum, bay-bee!

I'm not a developer - is that okay?

Absolutely! If you're in to design, UX, Project Management, any kind of coding, or are just curious and want to connect with tech-minded folks this is still the place for you. Get on in here!

Help us improve this page!
